intro: Mecodium apiculatum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved mecodium, is a perennial herb native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its slender, upright growth habit. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are small, tubular, and typically occur in clusters, displaying shades of purple or pink. Mecodium apiculatum is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
